results.title: Male and female
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Let’s Talk about It”.
Part one of a three part series which follows through the educational experiences of an upper primary school class as they learn about human reproduction and sexuality. In this part the children explore their concepts of ‘maleness’ and ‘femaleness’ with their teachers, learning about anatomical differences, the process of fertilisation and conception. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Dumbo: a lesson in being prepared
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Youngsters learn the pitfalls of trying things before they are prepared in this episode from Dumbo. Timothy Mouse pricks Dumbo with a pin to make him perform, despite the fact that Dumbo feels uncertain about his act. The result is a crashing failure that literally brings down the house. A charmingly anarchic affray, rendered with all the wide-eyed wonder of the Disney studio halcyon era.

results.title: The Jungle book: a lesson in accepting change
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
Concerns the story of a young boy faced with the dilema of moving away from the place he has grown up in. Incorporates the analogy of the young boy brought up by wolves in the Jungle Book story. Interesting combination of live scenes between the boy and his uncle, indispersed with the animated sequences.

results.title: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This film is a promotional device for the Disney animated feature “The Fox and the hound”. It is a cautionary tale about a young fox named Tod is taken in by an old woman after his mother is killed by a hunter. Full of mischief, young Tod befriends Copper, a hound dog pup. As they grow up, however, their friendship becomes endangered by what they have become - Copper is a hunting dog, and Tod is his prey. Live action written by Philip Abbot who stars as “Uncle Phil.”
results.title_for_label: The Fox and the hound: a lesson in caution
results.creator_credit_for_label: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Educational Media Company

results.title: Cinderella: a lesson in compromise
results.creator_credit: Philip Abbott and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lessons in Living II”.
This “moral tale” discusses the concept of greed and how things should be distributed equally. Two children fight over the proceeds of a product they made and need their uncle to teach them how to fairly share the profit. The uncle uses an excerpt from a Disney cartoon (Lucifer the cat and Cinderella story) in order to convey his message across. Cast includes Philip Abbott, Ruth Lind and Dylan Paiz.

results.title: It feels like you're left out of the world (TEFC): experiencing learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Learning Series”.
Children speak of their attitudes towards their own learning disabilities, and of the way in which their life has been affected by these disabilities. Articulates the personal and social consequences of having a learning problem - the feeling of being a failure is a classroom lesson that many of these children never forget. Shows that the children given time and special help, their problems can be overcome.

results.title: Teaching the way they learn: remediation of learning disabilities
results.creator_credit: Barrie Angus McLean, Robert Anderson, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Robert Anderson Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Learning Series”
Dr Sam Rabinovitch explains some of the methods used in teaching children with learning disabilities due to poor listening ability or poor bodily coordination. Points out how important it is that the child learns and understands what is being taught.
